item.title: Cate Blanchett gets tattoo to celebrate Oscar win?
item.description: Oscar-winning actress Cate Blanchett celebrates her Oscar win with a new tattoo

item.title: I have not even slept since winning Oscar: Lupita Nyong'o
item.description: '12 Years a Slave' actress Lupita Nyong'o says she has been sleepless since her Oscar win

item.title: Nicholas Hoult to star in 'Kill Your Friends'
item.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult will feature in 'Kill Your Friends', a movie based on John Niven's 2008 book of the same name

item.title: I never thought I'd win an Oscar: Brad Pitt
item.description: Actor Brad Pitt says he never thought he would win an Oscar

item.title: Zoe Saldana in talks to play Eartha Kitt in biopic
item.description: Actress Zoe Saldana is in early talks to portray legendary singer Eartha Kitt in an untitled biopic

item.title: Selena Gomez is most elegant princess in the world: Bieber
item.description: Pop star Justin Bieber calls his former girlfriend Selena Gomez "most elegant princess in the world"

item.title: Scarlett Johansson expecting first child with fiance?
item.description: Actress Scarlett Johansson is reportedly pregnant with her first child with fianc√© Romain Dauriac

item.title: Jared Leto hasn't seen 'Dallas Buyers Club' yet
item.description: Actor Jared Leto, who won the Oscar for best supporting role in 'Dallas Buyers Club', hasn't seen the movie yet

item.title: Why did George Clooney skip Oscars?
item.description: George Clooney, who starred in 'Gravity', skipped 86th Academy awards to have his much-awaited vacation

item.title: Yes, I've been offered 'Jurassic Park 4': Irrfan
item.description: The makers of 'Jurassic Park 4' are courting acclaimed Indian actor Irrfan for an important role in the film

item.title: DiCaprio's Oscar loss garners mixed reaction online
item.description: "Always a bridesmaid, never the bride Leonardo DiCaprio," said a Twitter user

item.title: Julie Delpy says Oscars rigged by old rich men
item.description: "You just need to give them two or three presents and they're in your pocket," said French-American actress Julie Delpy

item.title: DeGeneres' five best Oscar monologue barbs
item.description: Stand-up comedian and host Ellen DeGeneres gave one of the better Oscar monologues in recent memory

item.title: Scottish independence is "too good to miss": Sean Connery
item.description: Sean Connery is the latest in a number of high-profile stars entering the Scottish independence debate

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres brings pizza and deadpan affability to Oscars
item.description: Comedienne and talk show star Ellen DeGeneres displayed her flair for playing informality for laughs

item.title: Review: 'Non-Stop'
item.description: Jaume Collet-Serra's 'Non-Stop', starring Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore, Scoot McNairy, Michelle Dockery, Nate Parker, Corey Stoll, Lupita Nyong'o, Omar Metwally, Jason Butler Harner, Linus Roache, Shea Whigham and Anson Mount, is a formulaic tense drama

item.title: Review: 'The Monuments Men'
item.description: George Clooney's 'The Monuments Men', starring Matt Damon, Bill Murray, John Goodman, Jean Dujardin, Bob Balaban, Hugh Bonneville, Cate Blanchett and Dimitri Leonidas, is a monumental mess

item.title: Review: 'Pompeii'
item.description: Paul W.S. Anderson's 'Pompeii', starring Kit Harington, Emily Browning, Jared Harris, Carrie-Anne Moss, Adewale Akkinnuoye-Agbaje, Jessica Lucas and Kiefer Sutherland, is a visual spectacle

item.title: Review: 'RoboCop'
item.description: Jose Padilha's 'RoboCop', starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton, Abbie Cornish, Jackie Earle Haley, Michael K. Williams, Jennifer Ehle, Jay Baruchel, Marianne Jean-Baptiste and Samuel L. Jackson, lacks momentum

item.title: Review: 'Vampire Academy'
item.description: Mark Waters' 'Vampire Academy', starring Zoey Deutch, Lucy Fry, Danila Kozlovsky, Dominic Sherwood and Gabriel Byrne, is limp and devoid of fangs

item.title: Review: 'Her'
item.description: Spike Jonze's 'Her', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Amy Adams, Rooney Mara, Olivia Wilde, Chris Pratt, Matt Letscher, Portia Doubleday and Scarlett Johansson, is a heartfelt romantic tale with brilliant actors

item.title: Review: 'The Lego Movie'
item.description: Christopher Miller and Phil Lord's 'The Lego Movie', featuring the voices of Chris Pratt, Will Ferrell, Elizabeth Banks, Will Arnett, Liam Neeson and Morgan Freeman, is a universally loveable film

item.title: Review: 'Lone Survivor'
item.description: Peter Berg's 'Lone Survivor', starring Mark Wahlberg, Ben Foster, Taylor Kitsch, Emile Hirsch, Ali Suliman and Alexander Ludwik, is a glorified war memorial

item.title: Review: 'Saving Mr. Banks'
item.description: A detailed appraisal of John Hancock's 'Saving Mr. Banks', starring Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Paul Giamatti, Jason Schwartzman, Colin Farrell, Bradley Whitford, Ruth Wilson, B.J. Novak, Rachel Griffiths, Dendrie Taylor, Kathy Baker, Victoria Summer, Ronan Vibert, Annie Buckley and Melanie Paxson

item.title: Review: '12 Years a Slave'
item.description: Steve McQueen's '12 Years a Slave', starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Fassbender, Benedict Cumberbatch, Brad Pitt, Lupita Nyong'o, Alfre Woodard, Adepero Oduye, Paul Dano and Sarah Paulson, is hauntingly disturbing

item.title: Review: 'Mandela: Long Walk To Freedom'
item.description: Justin Chadwick's 'Mandela: Long Walk To Freedom', starring Idris Elba, Deon Lotz, Naomie Harris and Terry Pheto, lacks emotional drive

item.title: Review: 'The Legend of Hercules'
item.description: Renny Harlin's 'The Legend of Hercules', starring Kellan Lutz, Scott Adkins, Liam McIntyre, Liam Garrigan, Johnathon Schaech, Roxana McKee, Gaia Weiss, Rade Serbedzija, Kenneth Cranham, Mariah Gale and Luke Newberry, leaves viewers gasping for meaningful cinema

item.title: Review: 'American Hustle'
item.description: David O. Russell's 'American Hustle', starring Christian Bale, Bradley Cooper, Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner, Jennifer Lawrence, Louis C.K., Jack Huston, Michael Pena, Elisabeth Rohm, is a well-crafted crime buster

item.title: Review: 'Grudge Match'
item.description: Peter Segal's 'Grudge Match', starring Sylvester Stallone, Robert De Niro, Kim Basinger, Kevin Hart, Alan Arkin and Jon Bernthal, is packed with adult humour

item.title: Review: 'The Wolf of Wall Street'
item.description: Martin Scorsese's 'The Wolf of Wall Street', starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie, Mathew McConaughey, Rob Reiner and Joanna Lumley, is an over-egged pudding, but worth it.

item.title: Review: 'The Secret Life of Walter Mitty'
item.description: Ben Stiller's 'The Secret Life of Walter Mitty', starring Ben Stiller, Kristen Wiig, Sean Penn, Shirley Maclaine, Adam Scott, Patton Oswalt, Kathryn Hahn, Josh Charles, Terence Bernie Hines and Adrian Martinez, is intriguing and appealing

item.title: Review: 'Inside Llewyn Davis'
item.description: Joel and Ethan Coen's 'Inside Llewyn Davis', starring Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, John Goodman, Garrett Hedlund, F. Murray Abraham, Justin Timberlake, Max Casella, Jerry Grayson, Robin Bartlett, Ethan Phillips, Stark Sands, Adam Driver and Jeanine Serralles, is simply interesting!

item.title: Review: 'Oldboy'
item.description: Spike Lee's 'Oldboy', starring Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Olsen, Sharlto Copley, Samuel L. Jackson, Michael Imperioli, Max Casella and Rami Malek, is unconventionally likeable

item.title: Review: 'The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug'
item.description: Peter Jackson's 'The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug', starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Evangeline Lilly, Orlando Bloom, Lee Pace, Luke Evans, Ken Stott, James Nesbitt, Benedict Cumberbatch, Hugo Weaving, Sylvester McCoy, Aidan Turner, Manu Bennett, Dean O'Gorman, Graham McTavish, Peter Hambleton, Mikael Persbrandt, Adam Brown, William Kircher, Jed Brophy, Conan Stevens, Stephen Hunter, Mark Hadlow, Billy Connolly and Stephen Fry, is an exciting visual opus

item.title: Review: 'The Hunger Games: Catching Fire'
item.description: Francis Lawrence's 'The Hunger Games: Catching Fire', starring Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Donald Sutherland, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Amanda Plummer, lacks spark
